item.title: Sage Digest 2026-03-02
item.description: Welcome everyone to journal club. Today we're diving into a really timely paper about using artificial intelligence to help identify catheter-associated urinary tract infections, or CAUTIs, in the hospital setting. Before we get rolling, I need to say that this discussion is educational only and not medical advice. We're here to critically appraise the evidence together. So we're looking at one paper today – Alshanqeeti 2026 – which evaluates whether GPT-4o, that large language model from OpenAI, can actually do the work of infection surveillance specialists? Exactly. And it's a fascinating question because if GenAI can help us identify these hospital-acquired infections reliably, that could potentially free up a lot of human time and reduce costs. But let's start with the basics. What kin
